comment: Sorry to everyone who apparently hates her, but I had zero problems. I sat in the back row and could hear her just fine (The guy in the row next to mine and I answered more questions than anyone else.) I used her book CONSTANTLY. The only reason I did well in her labs was because I watched her videos. Super nice woman. I have so much more to say!

I took her online class, and I swear her videos are from 2004. They're incredibly boring and she doesn't cover everything you need to know for her labs. Her online class space is horribly unorganized. OH and good luck if you use a MAC, she isn't familiar with the system and offers no Help with MAC issues Do not recommend.

Offers extra credit. Assignments are stereotypical for a C++ class. She takes points off for things when she never expressed the expectation, sometimes even if what you did wasnt "wrong" but just not the exact way she likes it. Lecture videos are boring but you don't have to watch them to learn the material. Responsive but hard to communicate with.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Boring lectures.  Pretty much fell asleep mid way in.  She doesn't speak up at so sit in the front if you want to learn.  Textbook was next to useless, but open book test, so there's that.  I recommend someone else
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Pierce is a horrible teacher, a tough grader, expects you to know things without even teaching them, and is very accessible. We will be in a lab and if your lab is before lecture you are doing a brand new lab on something she has never even taught and she expects you to be able to do it without help. And lectures are the most boring thing
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Literally she is one of the most boring professors in the entire school. She is a boring teacher and the first day we walked in to class she expected you to be able to write an entire computer code while by teaching anything. She is not very helpful during lab and is just not a good teacher
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: As long as you stay engaged in class, you should be fine. There's about 11 labs, 3 quizzes, and 3 homework assignments depending if you take the TR or MWF class (I took the TR class). If she offers to stay longer to help with assignments, DO IT! She sometimes just gives you a lot, if not all the codes for the program. Would take again!

Some dislike her teaching style because it's very to-the-point w/ no fluff.  Prof Pierce teaches like she codes (i.e. super efficient) which I found refreshing.  I had to work hard for an A, but Prof Pierce was always available in her office hours and was extremely helpful .Quizzes are hard, but lots of extra credit is available to boost grade.

Pierce is a good lecturer if she sees you trying to learn.  I missed one class and sat in front row so I think that's why I did as well as I did. I received most of the help from teaching assistant. He filled in the holes where I was missing information or confused. I recommend this class to those that have time to pursue help. Boring subject.

I took her for 1302 and she was amazing. She takes time and wont depart from a topic until shes sure you understand. Shes always in her office during office hours and always at class on time. Really understanding instructor and her assistant Logan is amazing.

Gives most of the lab code in class, leaving you to figure out one part in the actual lab (with the help of a lab assistant). Gives algorithms for the projects. Pretty tough grader and tests are difficult (even tough you can use the book). Lectures are VERY boring, but overall the class is pretty easy.

Pierce covers the labs so be prepared to take lengthy notes. Everything is written on the boards and she will change some of her code without explanation. She recommends reading from the book but does allow the book on the quizzes. She took attendance at the beginning of every class but did not seem to care if half the class wasn't in attendance.

She was a nice person. Extremely helpful. Knows her stuff well .. Lectures were extremely boring and she expects you to know all the stuff. She doesn't really teach the basics which makes it even tougher for first time c++ students. Tests are kinda hard but open note (useless though!!) labs are kind of hard and projects are tedious but "do-able."
Would recommend.  She covers everything that you need to know in class, and she is very helpful.

I wish there were other options besides her available. It's not that she was bad, it's just that a lot of us left the semester knowing exactly as much about programming as we did before the class, for better or worse. If you have never programmed before she is not recommended. However, if you are comfortable about your programming abilities, take.

Excellent Teacher. Sometimes writing on the board can lead to minor confusion, but nothing the labs that accompany the class could not fix. Always takes time to help and answer questions. Extremely understanding of your situation and takes that into account. Wish she taught more than just the introductory sequence.  Would highly recommend.

This teacher has very quiet and colorless lectures, however, she is thorough and the true learning comes from the labs that accompany the lecture. The applications are covered very nicely and the teacher and her lab assistant will always being hustling around the room to help. Her grading is very different to others, which takes getting used to.
Good teacher, boring lectures, but open book tests. I knew nothing of programming before but learned much from labs and projects. I am taking her for 1302 as well

She talks very quietly, and I get confused with her lectures when I think we're learning something new when it's the same thing we just talked about. But she is extremely helpful, she answers her emails in a timely manner, she answers questions in class and lab, and she'll go the extra mile to make sure you get the materials you need. Haven't finished the class yet, but so far I'm impressed!

She knows her stuff, but the class was kind of a let down. I felt like I had to teach myself a lot of the material. The labs and projects were a little hard for a beginner. If it wasn't for other students it would have been a lot harder. Also I had to double check my assignments because they were consistently graded wrong.

she is bad. spent most of my time correcting her in her lectures. dont take her if you have the choice. if you do take here her class is easy but you will have to learn it on you own but for her class its not hard

She is not a good teacher. Lectures are BOOOORING!. I came in with no experience. I basically learned all of what I know in the labs and projects.I worked hard to make an A. Extra-credit is mandatory =O Who does that really? Very strict when grading... one good thing tho, she allows open book tests!

Professor Roth's lectures are pretty boring, but the assignments and labs are real easy. She practically gives you the code for a majority of the labs. Put in a moderate amount of effort and you will get an A.

Roth is a nice person, and will do what she can do help you solve a problem. Her organization for projects, homework, and other assignments is bad. Much more involved and difficult than it needs to be. Not real savvy when it comes to using computers to be productive either. More knowledge of this would have increased her organization tenfold, and made all of the material much more accessible. I wouldn't recommend her, but she isn't too bad for someone who already has a grasp on programming. 5/10

She's very nice and a great person, but just not a good teacher to take. She teaches, and you think you totally understand everything until you get a test unlike any other practice test she's given. Expect to study hard and to read the book on your own. You can still get a good grade, but you're definitely going to work hard to get it.

She gives you some pre-made lab assignments then throws her own**** into it to make it very confusing. She is very boring, but if you can teach yourself how to program from reading the book then getting an A shouldn't be a problem. She is also very nice, and will accept late work with very little penalty. Tests are very easy.

I have to agree with most of the comments here, although I made an A I did come in with experience. Most learning was done on my own outside of class, she is nice but needs to take more control over the classroom and work on her presentation skills.

**Be Warned** if you are new to programming, stay away or form an alliance with someone who has had experience with programming. New comers have no chance of passing on their own. Terrible book. Hard tests. Nice professor though but that doesnt help your grade.

Roth is the prime example of a bad teacher. Her lectures are useless, and she is reluctant to help during her office hours. Be prepared to teach yourself. Her class is torture. I would not recomend her to anyone.  She SUCKS!!
Nice lady, but you don't learn much  from her lectures. Get used to teaching yourself, but she is very willing to give out of class help.
before taking this class, make sure you're comfortable learning on your own cause you won't learn much from her.
Boring as heck, but easy none-the-less
Very easy professor, but extremely boring in her lectures. Sometimes seems to not really know what she's talking about, or maybe she's just a bit spacey. Extremely nice though.
Really easy and helpful.  Will let you makeup work that you missed and still get full credit.
Kinda boring, but definately easy.  It didn't require a lot of effort to get an A.
